Amethyst Dragon Quests.name: Amethyst Dragon Quests
Amethyst Dragon Quests.description: If your character aspires to join the Purple Dragon Knights and has received a quest from an amethyst dragon, you can roll on the Amethyst Dragon Quests table to determine the quest.

results.1-1: “Destroy a cell of the Cult of the Dragon, and bring me the cult leader’s head.”
results.2-2: “Find a lance that befits my majesty.”
results.3-3: “Travel to another world. Return to me only once you have something worth showing.”
results.4-4: “A psychic disturbance pains me. Locate the monster causing this, and slay it.”
results.5-5: “I yearn to see an aerie atop a mountain of unparalleled beauty. Take this amethyst to such a place.”
results.6-6: “I sense the presence of a wayward flumph somewhere on this world. Help this flumph find its cloister.”

Cheese Bag Contents.name: Cheese Bag Contents
Cheese Bag Contents.description: When a character buys a cheese bag, roll on the Cheese Bag Contents table to determine the kind of cheese therein.

Cult of the Dragon Trinkets.name: Cult of the Dragon Trinkets
Cult of the Dragon Trinkets.description: Roll on the Cult of the Dragon Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Cult of the Dragon.

results.1-1: A dragon claw pendant on a leather cord
results.2-2: Ashes of a dracolich in a small brass canister
results.3-3: A map of an unknown dragon’s lair
results.4-4: A black pearl etched with a Draconic rune
results.5-5: A drop of dragon’s blood preserved in amber

Dragonscarred Blessings.name: Dragonscarred Blessings
Dragonscarred Blessings.description: If your character has undergone a sacrificial ritual and yet survived, you can roll on the Dragonscarred Blessings table to randomly determine the physical feature your character bears from the ordeal.

results.1-1: You bear a facial scar in the shape of a dragon.
results.2-2: You have vestigial dragon horns, vestigial wings, or a vestigial tail.
results.3-3: Your eyes have slitted pupils and vividly colored irises.
results.4-4: Parts of your skin are covered in patches of reptilian scales.
results.6-6: A flame crackles inside your chest, and you exhale bits of ash with every breath.
results.7-7: You crave and can digest foods your species would normally find inedible, such as whole eggs, raw poultry, dirt, or bones.
results.8-8: Your hair stands on end and crackles with static electricity.

results.1-1: A pair of earrings made from oak leaves that never wilt
results.2-2: A miniature model cottage made of twigs
results.3-3: A green-glowing firefly in a bottle
results.4-4: A gourd that sounds like rustling leaves when held to one’s ear
results.5-5: A preserved rabbit’s foot on a leather strap
results.6-6: An antler shaped like an Elvish rune

Harper Personas.name: Harper Personas
Harper Personas.description: A character with a Disguise Kit can assume a Harper persona by succeeding on a [[/check cha 10 format=long]] to apply makeup. When you learn a persona in this way, you can roll on the Harper Personas table to randomly determine what persona you learn.

results.1-1: Rusty Riba, a rowdy smith with a folksy accent, filthy fingernails, and a quick temper
results.2-2: Father Temino, a morose priest of Amaunator, Helm, Chauntea, or another well-known deity, who offers somber counsel in a monotone
results.3-3: Pippi Toobs, a talented but overeager busker, whose performances include whistling, sleight of hand, and foot juggling
results.4-4: Aargus, a humorless patriarch who’s always complaining about his seven good-for-nothing kids who ran off to become adventurers
results.5-5: Aunt Cecilia, a silent sage, friend of animals, and inveterate winker, who’s never without a bag of birdseed
results.6-6: Johann Overbridge, a scatterbrained rookie guard in ill-fitting armor who never has his papers in order
results.7-7: Vincent, a young thrill seeker and shameless heartbreaker with a fresh black eye and a cocky grin
results.8-8: Liza Lily, a flower seller with worried expression and a chronic cough, who looks even more pathetic than her wilted posies

Harper Trinkets.name: Harper Trinkets
Harper Trinkets.description: Roll on the Harper Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Harpers.

results.2-2: A powder compact with a hidden compartment
results.4-4: A trick coin that’s heads on both sides
results.6-6: A scroll of sheet music for an unknown instrument

Lords' Alliance Trinkets.name: Lords' Alliance Trinkets
Lords' Alliance Trinkets.description: Roll on the Lords’ Alliance Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Lords’ Alliance.

results.1-1: A scrap from a defeated army’s banner
results.2-2: A bit and bridle engraved with the name of a famous steed
results.3-3: The broken blade of a sword used in a famous battle
results.4-4: The left glove of a lord who went mysteriously missing
results.5-5: An articulated toy horse and knight
results.6-6: A spaulder emblazoned with the insignia of an unidentified lord

Mythal-Touched Magic.name: Mythal-Touched Magic
Mythal-Touched Magic.description: If a spell attack hits you or you fail a saving throw against a spell, you can take a Reaction to roll on the Mythal-Touched Magic table to create a magical effect. If an effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus the modifier of the ability increased by this feat and your Proficiency Bonus.

results.1-2: You and each creature within 15 feet of you make a [[/save Dexterity]] saving throw, taking Force damage equal to [[/damage 1d8 type=force]]{1d8} times the level of the triggering spell on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.3-7: You and the triggering spell’s caster form a telepathic link for 1 hour.
results.8-10: Gravity is reversed in a 15-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall Cylinder centered on you for 1 minute, per the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplReverseGra]{Reverse Gravity} spell.
results.11-13: You and the triggering spell’s caster each make a [[/save Constitution]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the &Reference[Stunned] condition until the end of its next turn.
results.14-17: You gain a +2 bonus to AC for 1 minute, potentially turning the triggering spell into a miss if it was a spell attack.
results.18-19: Any flammable, nonmagical object within 10 feet of the triggering spell’s caster that isn’t being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame, takes [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] damage, and is burning.
results.20-20: The triggering spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn’t expended.

Order of the Gauntlet Trinkets.name: Order of the Gauntlet Trinkets
Order of the Gauntlet Trinkets.description: Roll on the Order of the Gauntlet Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Order of the Gauntlet.

results.1-1: A white feather as heavy as lead
results.2-2: An empty vial made from stained glass
results.3-3: A single cone of gold-flecked incense
results.5-5: One half of a pair of manacles

Purple Dragon Knight Trinkets.name: Purple Dragon Knight Trinkets
Purple Dragon Knight Trinkets.description: Roll on the Purple Dragon Knight Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Purple Dragon Knights.

results.2-2: A common purple quartz cut to resemble a dragon’s eye
results.3-3: A signal whistle audible only to amethyst dragons
results.4-4: A robin’s egg encased in amber
results.5-5: A whetstone that leaves any blade it hones faintly glittery
results.6-6: A vamplate taken from a slain rival jouster

Red Wizard Trinkets.name: Red Wizard Trinkets
Red Wizard Trinkets.description: Roll on the Red Wizard Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Red Wizards.

results.1-1: A gnarled wand made from petrified yew
results.2-2: A glass jar containing the preserved heart of an unknown animal
results.3-3: A unicorn figurine carved from obsidian
results.4-4: A tattoo needle made from one of your own bones
results.5-5: A bronze amulet in the shape of a scorpion
results.6-6: A razor made of crimson steel

Zhentarim Trinkets.name: Zhentarim Trinkets
Zhentarim Trinkets.description: Roll on the Zhentarim Trinkets table to determine what trinket you have from your time with the Zhentarim.

results.1-1: A broken dagger etched with your name
results.2-2: A glass eye that always turns to face you
results.6-6: A contract on a slip of parchment that’s impervious to creases, tears, and fire
